$interpreted:
Lisa: In a few days, Ned and I are getting married.
Father has probably gotten over his temper tantrum, right?
Lisa: Seeing these two cans of motor oil should put him in a cheerful mood. Then I'll ask him to come to the wedding ceremony.
Lisa: Father, I...
Sherlock: Nice timing you got there!
Sherlock: Thank goodness that I have a habit of keeping track of my expenses. Here's a detailed receipt on how much you have cost me since you were a kid.
Sherlock: Pay me back my money before you want me to listen to anything.
Lisa: W, what kind of joke is this?

Sherlock: Who said this is a joke?
If you're going to marry, you are no longer an asset to me.
Sherlock: I have no reason to indulge in something that loses me money.
Lisa: Are you telling me that in the 20 years you've adopted me, you only treat me as an asset?
Sherlock: What else do you expect? If I knew you are going to leave me one day, I would have never taken you home with me back then.
Lisa: My, my, aren't you offended!
Sherlock: Indeed. So pay me back my money!

Lisa: You... YOU... 
You can go to your little **** shack and blow your own fuse! I hate you!
Lisa: I refuse to further acknowledge our father-daughter relation! From now on, you have no business interfering with my life!
Sherlock: Lisa!
Lisa: What?
Sherlock: You forgot the bill.
Lisa: Go to hell!

Sherlock: Motor oil...
Did Lisa just buy these for me?

In a few days, Ned and I are getting married.
Father has probably gotten over his temper tantrum, right?
Seeing these two cans of motor oil should put him in a cheerful mood. Then I'll ask him to come to the wedding ceremony.
Father, I...
Nice timing you got there!
Thank goodness that I have a habit of keeping track of my expenses. Here's a detailed receipt on how much you have cost me since you were a kid.
Pay me back my money before you want me to listen to anything.
W, what kind of joke is this?

Who said this is a joke?
If you're going to marry, you are no longer an asset to me.
I have no reason to indulge in something that loses me money.
Are you telling me that in the 20 years you've adopted me, you only treat me as an asset?
What else do you expect? If I knew you are going to leave me one day, I would have never taken you home with me back then.
My, my, aren't you offended!
Indeed. So pay me back my money!

You... YOU... 
You can go to your little **** shack and blow your own fuse! I hate you!
I refuse to further acknowledge our father-daughter relation! From now on, you have no business interfering with my life!
Lisa!
What?
You forgot the bill.
Go to hell!

Motor oil...
Did Lisa just buy these for me?
